world_news:
• [Nov 25, 2025, 1:00 PM] UN Report on Femicide: The United Nations released a comprehensive report detailing the global crisis of femicide and the surge in digital violence against women, calling for immediate international action.
  • [Nov 25, 2025, 11:20 AM] Italian Austerity Protests: Major cities across Italy, including Rome and Milan, were rocked by large-scale demonstrations over the weekend protesting the government's new austerity measures and the rising cost of living.
  • [Nov 25, 2025, 10:00 AM] Polio Eradication Milestone: Marking 25 years of being polio-free, leaders from Western Pacific countries renewed their commitment to global polio eradication efforts during a summit with the World Health Organization.
  • [Nov 24, 2025, 9:00 AM] Severe Flooding in Vietnam: Following a week of relentless rain, the city of Nha Trang in Vietnam is experiencing catastrophic flooding, leading to mass evacuations and significant damage to local infrastructure.
  • [Nov 23, 2025, 3:00 PM] Amazon Rainforest Protection Pact: A summit of Amazonian nation leaders in Brazil concluded with a new pact to increase shared resources and intelligence to fight illegal deforestation and protect indigenous lands.
  • [Nov 22, 2025, 5:00 PM] Global Supply Chain Disruption: A coordinated cyberattack on the Port of Singapore's terminal operating systems caused major delays in global shipping, impacting thousands of companies worldwide.
  • [Nov 21, 2025, 11:00 AM] EU Enforces Digital Services Act: The European Union levied its first major penalty under the new Digital Services Act against a major social media platform for failing to adequately address harmful disinformation.
  • [Nov 20, 2025, 2:30 PM] African Union Brokers Peace Talks: The African Union initiated urgent peace talks in Ethiopia to address the escalating conflict in the Sahel region, bringing together representatives from the conflicting parties for the first time.
  • [Nov 19, 2025, 12:00 PM] Alarming Report on Arctic Sea Ice: The International Cryosphere Climate Initiative released a report indicating that the Arctic sea ice reached its second-lowest minimum extent ever recorded this year, accelerating concerns about rising sea levels.
  • [Nov 18, 2025, 8:45 PM] International Space Station Crew Returns: A multinational crew of astronauts successfully landed in Kazakhstan after completing a six-month scientific research mission aboard the International Space Station.
us_news:
• [Nov 24, 8:37 AM] Topic: Trump Administration's Department of Government Efficiency (DOGE) Disbanded - The Department of Government Efficiency (DOGE), a key initiative of the second Trump administration, has been unexpectedly disbanded eight months ahead of its scheduled charter end. The department, which was led by Elon Musk, was aimed at cutting government waste.
  • [Nov 25, 7:23 AM] Topic: Trump's Battle with the BBC - The Federal Communications Commission (FCC) has launched an inquiry into the BBC, NPR, and PBS following accusations of biased coverage of the Trump administration. This move could threaten the BBC's operations in the U.S. and has raised concerns about press freedom.
  • [Nov 24, 4:26 PM] Topic: DHS Ends Temporary Protected Status for Myanmar - Department of Homeland Security Secretary Kristi Noem announced the termination of Temporary Protected Status (TPS) for Myanmar (also known as Burma), effective January 26. The decision will affect nearly 4,000 residents who will now face potential deportation.
  • [Nov 20, 12:14 AM] Topic: Border Patrol Surveillance Program Revealed - A secretive U.S. Border Patrol program has been revealed to be monitoring the travel patterns of millions of American drivers. The program uses a vast network of license plate readers to track vehicles and identify individuals with 'suspicious' travel histories, raising significant privacy concerns.
  • [Nov 21, 9:29 PM] Topic: Federal Judge Blocks IRS from Sharing Taxpayer Data with ICE - A federal judge issued a ruling preventing the Internal Revenue Service (IRS) from sharing taxpayer address information with Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE). The judge stated that such sharing would violate federal law and the privacy of taxpayers.
  • [Nov 18, 1:15 PM] Topic: Federal Judges Block Texas Redistricting Map - A panel of federal judges has blocked Texas from using its newly drawn congressional map for the 2026 midterm elections. The court found that the map, created by the Republican-controlled legislature, likely violates the Voting Rights Act by diluting the voting power of minority communities.
  • [Nov 24, 4:30 PM] Topic: Former Senator Doug Jones to Run for Alabama Governor - Former U.S. Senator Doug Jones (D-Ala.) announced his campaign for governor of Alabama. Jones, who lost his Senate seat in 2020, is a prominent Democratic figure in a deeply Republican state.
  • [Nov 18, 6:00 AM] Topic: US Revives Jungle Warfare Training in Panama - For the first time in over two decades, the U.S. military has re-established a jungle warfare training program in Panama. The move is seen as a response to growing instability and the presence of armed groups in the region.
  • [Nov 18, 2:53 PM] Topic: Texas Governor Designates Muslim Brotherhood and CAIR as Terrorist Groups - Texas Governor Greg Abbott signed a proclamation officially designating the Muslim Brotherhood and the Council on American-Islamic Relations (CAIR) as foreign terrorist organizations within the state. The move has been met with criticism from civil rights groups.
  • [Nov 18, 3:16 PM] Topic: US Mint Ceases Production of the Penny - The U.S. Mint has officially ended the production of the penny after more than 230 years. The decision comes after years of debate over the coin's utility and the rising cost of its production.
tech_news:
• [Nov 25, 2025, 12:12 PM] CISA Spyware Warning: The U.S. Cybersecurity and Infrastructure Security Agency (CISA) issued a warning about active spyware campaigns targeting high-value Signal and WhatsApp users. Attackers are using commercial spyware and Remote Access Trojans (RATs) to hijack accounts and spy on officials.
  • [Nov 25, 2025, 10:19 AM] Developer Tool Data Leak: Researchers uncovered a massive data leak from popular developer tools JSONFormatter and CodeBeautify, exposing over 5GB of sensitive data, including thousands of passwords and API keys.
  • [Nov 22, 2025, 11:49 AM] APT31 Cyberattacks: A China-linked hacking group, APT31, has been conducting a long-running, stealthy cyber-espionage campaign against Russian IT companies since 2022, using cloud services and social media for command-and-control to steal sensitive data.
  • [Nov 22, 2025, 7:15 AM] Oracle Zero-Day: CISA has added a critical zero-day vulnerability in Oracle Identity Manager to its Known Exploited Vulnerabilities (KEV) catalog. The flaw is being actively exploited, and federal agencies have been ordered to apply patches.
  • [Nov 21, 2025, 8:05 AM] SEC Drops SolarWinds Case: The U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) has dropped its case against SolarWinds related to the massive 2020 cyberattack, as recent court rulings have undercut the SEC's key allegations.
  • [Nov 21, 2025, 6:02 AM] Salesforce Data Breach: Salesforce is investigating a security incident involving unauthorized access to customer data through a third-party application, Gainsight, linked to the ShinyHunters threat actor and the abuse of OAuth tokens.
  • [Nov 21, 2025, 1:30 PM] Android's Quick Share gets AirDrop support: Google announced that Android's Quick Share feature will soon be compatible with Apple's AirDrop, allowing seamless file sharing between Android and iOS devices.
  • [Nov 21, 2025, 4:41 PM] UN Climate Talks Deadlocked: At the UN climate talks (COP30), negotiators are struggling to agree on a global roadmap for transitioning away from fossil fuels, with the EU's climate commissioner warning of a 'no-deal scenario.'
  • [Nov 20, 2025, 11:34 AM] New Android Trojan: A new Android banking trojan named Sturnus has been discovered, capable of capturing encrypted chats, taking over infected devices, and targeting European financial institutions.
  • [Nov 18, 2025, 11:52 AM] Apple Watch Series 11 Price Drop: The recently released Apple Watch Series 11 has seen its first major discount, with prices dropping to a record low ahead of the Black Friday shopping season.
financial_news:
• [Nov 25, 1:24 PM] Klarna's Stablecoin Launch: Swedish fintech firm Klarna announced on Tuesday its intention to launch a U.S. dollar-backed stablecoin, marking a significant move into digital assets amidst increasing regulatory scrutiny of the sector.
  • [Nov 25, 12:55 PM] EU's Ukraine Loan: A planned 140 billion euro ($161 billion) loan for Ukraine from the EU, backed by frozen Russian assets, is unlikely to negatively impact the sovereign ratings of EU countries, according to two major credit rating agencies.
  • [Nov 25, 4:15 PM] UK's Stance on Russian Assets: British Prime Minister Keir Starmer stated on Tuesday that London is prepared to align with the European Union in providing financial support to Ukraine, utilizing the value of "immobilised" Russian assets.
  • [Nov 25, 11:39 AM] Morning Market Outlook: The U.S. stock market is poised for a quiet open on Tuesday as investors await key consumer confidence data, which could influence the Federal Reserve's upcoming interest rate decisions.
  • [Nov 25, 7:57 AM] ECB Probes Deutsche Bank: The European Central Bank is currently investigating allegations that Deutsche Bank understated risks on its balance sheet, potentially presenting a misleading picture of its financial health, as reported by the Financial Times.
  • [Nov 25, 6:56 PM] EBRD Warning on Aging Populations: The European Bank for Reconstruction and Development (EBRD) warned in its annual report on Tuesday that countries must take immediate action to prevent slowing population growth from severely damaging their long-term economic prospects, calling it a 'ticking time bomb'.
  • [Nov 23, 4:50 PM] European Counter-Proposal on Ukraine: Reuters obtained the full text of a European counter-proposal to the United States' draft 28-point peace plan for Ukraine, indicating ongoing negotiations and potential shifts in international policy.
  • [Sep 25, 2025] Citadel CEO on Fed Rate Cuts: Citadel CEO Ken Griffin stated in a CNBC interview that he expects the U.S. Federal Reserve to implement one more interest rate cut this year, offering a prominent market leader's perspective on monetary policy.
  • [Sep 11, 2025] Fed's Divergence on Rate Cuts: The U.S. Federal Reserve appears to be an outlier among central banks in developed markets, as it is poised to resume rate cuts while many of its international counterparts are nearing the end of their easing cycles.
conspiracies:
• [Nov 22, 5:49 PM] Theory: President Trump's friendship with Jeffrey Epstein is a focus of conspiracy theories, with some speculating about the extent of their relationship and potential involvement in Epstein's crimes.
  • [Nov 22, 9:26 PM] Theory: A conspiracy theory alleges that Israel's Mossad used Jeffrey Epstein as an agent. Former Israeli Prime Minister Naftali Bennett has publicly denied this, stating that Israel has not operated on American soil since the 1980s.
  • [Nov 23, 11:24 PM] Theory: The release of a new documentary, 'The Age of Disclosure,' has fueled theories about a government cover-up of alien contact. The film features testimony from individuals like David Grusch, who claim to have knowledge of non-human intelligence and technology.
  • [Nov 20, 10:50 PM] Theory: RFK Jr. is accused of promoting conspiracy theories that undermine trust in vaccines, specifically reviving the debunked claim that vaccines cause autism.
  • [Nov 24, 12:25 AM] Theory: A belief is circulating that the Trump administration is taking illegal steps to abolish the Department of Education, causing alarm among students, families, and educators.
  • [Nov 21, 8:54 PM] Theory: It is being suggested that President Trump is punishing 'Blue states' by withholding FEMA aid after natural disasters, specifically mentioning the denial of aid to Washington state after a bomb cyclone.
  • [Nov 21, 7:25 PM] Theory: There are renewed calls for an investigation into Russian interference in UK politics, spurred by the sentencing of former Reform UK politician Nathan Gill for bribery and his connections to Nigel Farage.
  • [Nov 24, 9:37 PM] Theory: The Trump administration's 'Department of Government Efficiency' (DOGE) is being called a catastrophic failure, with theories suggesting it was a tool to dismantle crucial government functions, including cancer research and humanitarian aid.
  • [Nov 20, 9:37 PM] Theory: Concerns are being raised that President Trump is using his platform to incite political violence, with critics pointing to his rhetoric regarding Democratic lawmakers and drawing parallels to the events of January 6th.
  • [Nov 22, 11:04 PM] Theory: The Skeptic Research Center has proposed that rising trends in mental illness identification may be a form of 'social contagion,' suggesting that mental health issues can spread through social networks.
